title: How I Use RSS To “Rewild” My Attention - Clive Thompson - Medium

last_post.content:
"How I Use RSS To 'Rewild' My Attention"

My essay on the joys of using RSS to follow 400 weird, offbeat, niche blogs and sites that cater to my particular obsessions ...

... and how it helps me find more fascinating, deeper material than I see on algorthmically-sorted-for-virality social media

The piece, for Medium subscribers: https://clivethompson.medium.com/how-i-use-rss-to-rewild-my-attention-7731267a40d8

I've found WAY MORE interactions and engagement here than I ever had on Twitter. Plus fewer death threats.

title: Defeat chokepoint capitalism to get artists paid

last_post.content:
In other words, today creators have *more* copyright, the companies that buy creators' copyrights have *more* profits, but creators are *poorer* than they were 40 years ago. How can this be so?

As Rebecca Giblin and I explain in our book #ChokepointCapitalism, the sums creators get from media and tech companies aren't determined by how durable or far-reaching copyright is - rather, they're determined by the *structure of the creative market*.

https://chokepointcapitalism.com/

5/

My latest book is Chokepoint Capitalism (with Rebecca Giblin), nonfiction about monopoly and fairness in creative labor markets.

https://chokepointcapitalism.com

Signed copies available from Book Soup:

https://www.booksoup.com/book/9780807007068

--

title: FOSDEM 2023 - Podcasting 2.0: it's all about Interoperability

last_post.content:
I had no idea the innovations happening in the open podcasting space, e.g. fediverse support and an open index as an alternative to Apple's. This is a really nice overview from FOSDEM 2023.

#podcast #podcasting #fosdem

https://fosdem.org/2023/schedule/event/podcasting20/

Power analyses should not be based on the effect you expect but on the smallest effect size of interest. You commonly hear people say power analysis is not possible because you don't know the effect size. But this is a (common) misunderstanding of what you are suposed to do in a power analysis. You plan for the effect you do not want to miss - not for a guess of what it might be. See https://online.ucpress.edu/collabra/article/8/1/33267/120491/Sample-Size-Justification

title: Open aanpak voor Open Science | NWO

last_post.content:
Work update: I will be leaving the @utrechtuniversity.

As of April 1st, I will start as programme leader Open Scholarly Communication as part of the National Initiative Open Science.

Together with all Dutch knowledge institutions, we aim to make open science the norm in the years to come.

I am honored and proud to be able to contribute to this in the coming years.

More about the RO OS: https://www.nwo.nl/nieuws/open-aanpak-voor-open-science

title: Theory of Mind May Have Spontaneously Emerged in Large Language Models

last_post.content: Theory of Mind May Have Spontaneously Emerged in Large Language Models - https://arxiv.org/abs/2302.02083

Yet another example of how incredibly difficult it is to protect these large language model systems against prompt injection attacks

I wrote about how frustratingly difficult it was to find a solution for these back in September: https://simonwillison.net/2022/Sep/16/prompt-injection-solutions/

Microsoft have been working directly with OpenAI to build this for several months now... and despite that, they still didn't manage to protect against these attacks!

title: On Mastodon — Four Months (and Five Years) Later — @glecharles — As in guillotine...

last_post.content:
"I still don’t consider Mastodon a straight Twitter alternative — at least not the Twitter we’ve come to know during the Trump/Musk Error — but it has replaced the Twitter I used to know & love back in the day. I’m no longer getting a steady feed of breaking “news” & half-baked hot takes...[or] drowning in a raging feed of varying relevance & quality...My feed is calmer as I’m slowly & deliberately rebuilding my network...rethinking how I want to engage on social media."

https://loudpoet.com/2023/02/09/on-mastodon-four-months-and-five-years-later/

title: Elon Musk fires a top Twitter engineer over his declining view count

last_post.content:
“Interviews with current Twitter employees paint a picture of a deeply troubled workplace, where Musk’s whim-based approach to product management leaves workers scrambling to implement new features even as the core service falls apart. The disarray makes it less likely that Musk will ever recoup the $44 billion he spent to buy Twitter, and may hasten its decline into insolvency.”

The Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team (HOT) is calling for volunteers to participate in an estimated 2-week mapping response to flesh out coverage in OpenStreetMap of areas of Turkey and Syria affected by the recent catastrophic earthquakes. Following validation by experienced OSM contributors, the resulting data will be immediately & freely available to aid organizations engaged in planning & execution of emergency response & recovery operations in the earthquake zone.

https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/2023_Turkey_Earthquakes#For_Mappers
